title: The Tabernacle Furnishings
shortSummary: Exodus 38 details the construction and materials of the altar of burnt offering, the laver, and the court surrounding the tabernacle, emphasizing precise obedience to God's commands. This chapter highlights the craftsmanship and dedication of the artisans, as well as the careful accounting of the offerings used in the sanctuary's construction. It underscores the holiness and order required in worship.
timeline: c. 1446 BC - The Exodus and Wilderness Tabernacle Construction

keyCharacters.name: Bezaleel
keyCharacters.description: A skilled craftsman from the tribe of Judah who led the construction of the tabernacle furnishings as commanded by the LORD.

keyCharacters.name: Aholiab
keyCharacters.description: An engraver and embroiderer from the tribe of Dan who assisted Bezaleel in making the tabernacle's intricate works.

keyCharacters.name: Ithamar
keyCharacters.description: Son of Aaron the priest, responsible for overseeing the counting and service of the Levites related to the tabernacle.

definitions.definition: A durable, dense wood from the acacia tree, used extensively in the tabernacle's construction for its strength and resistance.
An ancient unit of measurement roughly equivalent to 18 inches or 45 centimeters, based on the length of a forearm.
A basin made of brass used by the priests for ceremonial washing before entering the tabernacle, symbolizing purification.
Decorative bands or strips of silver used to adorn the pillars and chapiters of the tabernacle court.

outline.heading: Construction of the Altar of Burnt Offering
outline.description: This section describes the detailed construction of the altar of burnt offering, including its dimensions, materials, and accessories, emphasizing its importance for sacrificial worship.

outline.heading: The Court of the Tabernacle
outline.description: The chapter outlines the dimensions and materials of the tabernacle court's hangings, pillars, sockets, and gate, highlighting the beauty and orderliness of the worship space.

outline.heading: Summary of the Tabernacle Work and Leadership
outline.description: This passage credits Bezaleel and Aholiab for their skilled craftsmanship in fulfilling God's commands, and notes Ithamar's role in overseeing the Levites' service.

outline.heading: Accounting of Materials Used
outline.description: A detailed inventory of the gold, silver, and brass used in the tabernacle's construction is given, demonstrating faithful stewardship and transparency in the sacred work.

application: Obedience to God's specific instructions in worship reflects reverence and honors Him; Christians should seek to follow God's Word carefully in all aspects of life.
The skilled work of Bezaleel and Aholiab teaches the value of using God-given talents diligently for His service and the building up of His kingdom.
The detailed accounting of offerings reminds believers to be faithful stewards of the resources God entrusts to them, practicing integrity and gratitude.
The emphasis on purification and holiness in the tabernacle furnishings encourages Christians to pursue personal holiness and spiritual cleansing through Christ.

keyVerses.text: And Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that the LORD commanded Moses.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights faithful obedience and skilled craftsmanship in fulfilling God's commands.

keyVerses.text: This is the sum of the tabernacle, even of the tabernacle of testimony, as it was counted, according to the commandment of Moses, for the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, son to Aaron the priest.
keyVerses.significance: It underscores the organized and reverent approach to worship and service in the tabernacle.

keyVerses.text: And he made the laver of brass, and the foot of it of brass, of the lookingglasses of the women assembling, which assembled at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
keyVerses.significance: This verse shows the communal contribution to the tabernacle and the importance of purification in worship.
